Investigate the expression 4y(y + 1) to understand its properties, such as whether it is always even or odd.

Scan through small values of x to test if they satisfy the equation, looking to establish a pattern or find specific solutions.
Use modular arithmetic to exclude certain values of x by checking if x^3 + 3 can evoke integers when equations are considered modulo different numbers.
Consider if a deeper algebraic factorization or transformation might simplify the equation, making the search for solutions more straightforward.
If possible values of x are identified, solve for y using these x values and verify if the obtained values of y are positive integers.
